answers.text: response to changes in food availability, habitat, or weather

qas.question: How many species of birds are there?
How many bird species are long distance migrants?
Which direction do birds primarily migrate?

context: Migration is the regular seasonal movement, often <a4_0>north and south<a4_0/>, undertaken by many species of birds. Bird movements include those made in <a0_0>response to changes in food availability, habitat, or weather<a0_0/>. Sometimes, journeys are not termed "true migration" because they are irregular (nomadism, invasions, irruptions) or in only one direction (dispersal, movement of young away from natal area). Migration is marked by its annual seasonality. Non-migratory birds are said to be <a1_0>resident or sedentary<a1_0/>. Approximately <a3_0>1800<a3_0/> of the world's <a2_0>10,000<a2_0/> bird species are long-distance migrants.
